thread.title: MCLA volleyball's win streak stopped at 13
thread.title_full: MCLA volleyball's win streak stopped at 13

author:
Berkshire Eagle Staff
sports@berkshireeagle.com , @EagleSportsZone on Twitter
title: MCLA volleyball's win streak stopped at 13
text:
MCLA volleyball's win streak stopped at 13 Volleyball team beats Elmira, but falls to Nazareth Posted: 10/03/2015 12:31:07 AM EDT Updated: 10/03/2015 12:32:41 AM EDT 
It had almost been a full month since a college volleyball team last defeated MCLA before late Friday night. 
The Trailblazers ran their win streak to 13 matches Friday night, beating Elmira in four sets in the opener of the Hartwick (N.Y.) Invitational, before Nazareth stopped the streak with a three-set sweep. 
Against Elmira, Allison Clark led the way for MCLA (14-4) with 18 kills and 13 digs. Chanielle Enomoto had 24 digs for the Trailblazers. 
MCLA plays host Hartwick and Morrisville State today. The 'Blazers' next home match is Oct. 15 against Smith College. 
WILLIAMS CROSS COUNTRY 
At Bethlehem, Pa., the Williams men took 13th place at the Paul Short Run at Lehigh University. The women's team finished 17th in a field that included runners from Divisions I, II and III. 
Leading the Williams men — the highest-placing D-III team in the field — was senior captain Bijan Mazaheri. He was seventh overall in 24:09. 
The women's team, ranked second in the latest D-III national poll, were led by sophomore Victoria Kingham (21:26, 41st place) in the Gold 6-K run. Tennis 
WILLIAMS MEN 9, RPI 0 
At Williamstown, the Ephs swept all matches for their second win of the season. 
Williams will play in the Dartmouth Invitational next week to wrap up its fall schedule. Advertisement
